results.title: Kip and David. Episode 10.
results.creator_credit: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Kip and David”.
It is a rainy day and Kip and David play indoors. They decide to try potato printing and create some curtains. After the rain, they put the curtains up in Kip’s house. Music by Nancy Tow. Narrated by Roy Dunlop.

results.title: Kip and David. Episode 09
results.creator_credit: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Kip and David”.
Kip and David visit ‘Lamington National Park’ set high in the mountains. They see the rain forest with its giant trees, creepers, mosses and lichens, waterfalls and pools. They float leaf-boats down the small waterfalls, find a satin bower-bird’s playground and inspect the strange assortment of blue objects in it. Finally, they feed the wild scrub turkeys, bower birds, wild parrots and other small birds. Music by Nancy Tow. Narrated by Roy Dunlop.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films

results.title: Kip and David. Episode 08
results.creator_credit: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Kip and David”.
It is David’s birthday and Kip is the first to greet him, playing ‘Happy Birthday’ on his pipes. David is given a small microscope and some boxes of prepared slides. They look at some of these and then find things in the garden to inspect under the microscope. The postman brings another parcel, which contains an irrepressible Jack-in-the-Box. Music by Nancy Tow. Narrated by Roy Dunlop.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films

results.title: Kip and David. Episode 07
results.creator_credit: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Kip and David”.
Violent windy weather prevents Kip a David from playing in the garden. After the gale they survey the damage and cut away a fallen banana palm. They find a young injured bird and care for it until it is strong enough to fly away. They also encounter a giant stick insect on a grapefruit tree. Music by Nancy Tow. Narrated by Roy Dunlop.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films

results.title: Kip and David. Episode 06
results.creator_credit: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Kip and David”.
David is called by his elfin friend Kip to look at a fascinating spiky caterpillar. They watch as it spins its cup-shaped cocoon and observe a spider forming its web to trap unwary insects. They build a cage for the cocoon and later see the newly emerged moth. Music by Nancy Tow. Narrated by Roy Dunlop.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films

results.title: Kip and David. Episode 05
results.creator_credit: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Kip and David”.
David and his elfin friend work together on Kip’s tree house, using a framework of branches, thatching it with banana leaves and leaving spaces for a doorway and window. Finally, they build a rock garden, and place ‘Kip’s House’ above the entrance. Music by Nancy Tow. Narrated by Roy Dunlop.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films

results.title: Kip and David. Episode 02
results.creator_credit: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Kip and David”.
Kip, the bushland elf, and David explore their holiday island and find a huge Aboriginal midden-heap of bleached white shells. They then move onto the beach and rock pools looking for shellfish and crabs. Music by Nancy Tow. Narrated by Roy Dunlop.

results.title: Kip and David. Episode 01
results.creator_credit: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Kip and David”.
David, a young boy, goes by boat to Stradbroke Island on a holiday. As he collects Banksia cones in the bush, he hears honey-eaters followed by piping music played by a friendly elf. Together they explore the caves along the coast. Music by Nancy Tow. Narrated by Roy Dunlop.

results.title: Kip and David
results.creator_credit: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description: A thirteen part children’s adventure series made by Arthur and Corinne Cantrill about a young boy called David who meets a bushland elf while holidaying on Queensland’s Stradbroke Island and embarks on a series of adventures that highlight Australia’s wildlife and natural surroundings.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.description: A thirteen part children’s adventure series made by Arthur and Corinne Cantrill about a young boy called David who meets a bushland elf while holidaying on Queensland’s Stradbroke Island and embarks on a series of adventures that highlight Australia’s wildlife and natural surroundings.
description_for_label: A thirteen part children’s adventure series made by Arthur and Corinne Cantrill about a young boy called David who meets a bushland elf while holidaying on Queensland’s Stradbroke Island and embarks on a series of adventures that highlight Australia’s wildlife and natural surroundings.
